intro: Paraglycine digitata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Paraglycine digitata is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus. It is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments.
